In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the number **seven** (or **7**) is not used to represent anything by default. However, it can still solve the following purposes:

- [7]() and the other number keys can be used to specify a [numeric prefix](/wiki/Numeric_prefix "Numeric prefix") for a command or in a menu.

* If numpad movement is on, press [7]() to move north-west.

- Some players also change the "monsters" option in the [options](/wiki/Options "Options") file to utilize [unused symbols](/wiki/Unused_symbols "Unused symbols") like 7 for certain purposes, e.g. usually to represent [golems](/wiki/Golem "Golem") in place of the [apostrophe](/wiki/Apostrophe "Apostrophe") ('), or [sea monsters](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster") in place of the [semicolon](/wiki/Semicolon "Semicolon") (;), and make them easier to see.

## Variants

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [lawful angels and minions](/wiki/Lawful_angels_and_minions "Lawful angels and minions") use the 7 glyph.

dNetHack moves many of the existing lawful angelic beings and minions to the 7 glyph, and adds several more monsters that use the glyph:

- 7 [couatl](/wiki/Couatl "Couatl")
- 7 [Aleax](/wiki/Aleax "Aleax")
- 7 [Angel](/wiki/Angel "Angel")
- 7 [ki-rin](/wiki/Ki-rin "Ki-rin")
- 7 [Justice Archon](/wiki/Justice_Archon "Justice Archon")
- 7 [Sword Archon](/wiki/Sword_Archon "Sword Archon")
- 7 [Shield Archon](/wiki/Shield_Archon "Shield Archon")
- 7 [Trumpet Archon](/wiki/Trumpet_Archon "Trumpet Archon")
- 7 [Warden Archon](/wiki/Warden_Archon "Warden Archon")
- 7 [Throne Archon](/wiki/Throne_Archon "Throne Archon")
- 7 [Light Archon](/wiki/Light_Archon "Light Archon")
- 7 [Iasoian Archon](/index.php?title=Iasoian_Archon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Iasoian Archon (page does not exist)")
- 7 [Panakeian Archon](/index.php?title=Panakeian_Archon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Panakeian Archon (page does not exist)")
- 7 [Hygieian Archon](/index.php?title=Hygieian_Archon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Hygieian Archon (page does not exist)")
- 7 [Poro Aulon](/index.php?title=Poro_Aulon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Poro Aulon (page does not exist)")
- 7 [harrower of Zariel](/wiki/Harrower_of_Zariel "Harrower of Zariel")
- 7 [Giant Eagle](/wiki/Giant_Eagle "Giant Eagle")
- 7 [Barachiel](/wiki/Barachiel "Barachiel")
- 7 [Domiel](/wiki/Domiel "Domiel")
- 7 [Erathaol](/wiki/Erathaol "Erathaol")
- 7 [Astaphaios](/wiki/Astaphaios "Astaphaios")
- 7 [Raziel](/wiki/Raziel "Raziel")
- 7 [Sealtiel](/wiki/Sealtiel "Sealtiel")
- 7 [Zaphkiel](/wiki/Zaphkiel "Zaphkiel")
- 7 [God](/wiki/God_\(dNetHack\) "God (dNetHack)")
- 7 [arcadian avenger](/wiki/Arcadian_avenger "Arcadian avenger")
- 7 [damaged arcadian avenger](/wiki/Damaged_arcadian_avenger "Damaged arcadian avenger")
- 7 [Apollyon](/wiki/Apollyon "Apollyon")

### SpliceHack

In older versions of [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), the [sin](/wiki/Sin "Sin") monster class was represented by the 7 glyph. Both the monster class and its members have been removed from the game in later versions, though their shared encyclopedia entry still remains in the game data.

SpliceHack had seven defunct sin monsters, with one for each of the Seven Deadly Sins:

- 7 Wrath
- 7 Sloth
- 7 Pride
- 7 Greed
- 7 Lust
- 7 Gluttony
- 7 Envy

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the number seven (or 7) is not used to represent anything by default. However, it can still solve the following purposes:

  • 7 and the other number keys can be used to specify a numeric prefix for a command or in a menu.
  • If numpad movement is on, press 7 to move north-west.
  • Some players also change the "monsters" option in the options file to utilize unused symbols like 7 for certain purposes, e.g. usually to represent golems in place of the apostrophe ('), or sea monsters in place of the semicolon (;), and make them easier to see.

Variants

dNetHack

In dNetHack, lawful angels and minions use the 7 glyph.

dNetHack moves many of the existing lawful angelic beings and minions to the 7 glyph, and adds several more monsters that use the glyph:

  • 7 couatl
  • 7 Aleax
  • 7 Angel
  • 7 ki-rin
  • 7 Justice Archon
  • 7 Sword Archon
  • 7 Shield Archon
  • 7 Trumpet Archon
  • 7 Warden Archon
  • 7 Throne Archon
  • 7 Light Archon
  • 7 Iasoian Archon
  • 7 Panakeian Archon
  • 7 Hygieian Archon
  • 7 Poro Aulon
  • 7 harrower of Zariel
  • 7 Giant Eagle
  • 7 Barachiel
  • 7 Domiel
  • 7 Erathaol
  • 7 Astaphaios
  • 7 Raziel
  • 7 Sealtiel
  • 7 Zaphkiel
  • 7 God
  • 7 arcadian avenger
  • 7 damaged arcadian avenger
  • 7 Apollyon

SpliceHack

In older versions of SpliceHack, the sin monster class was represented by the 7 glyph. Both the monster class and its members have been removed from the game in later versions, though their shared encyclopedia entry still remains in the game data.

SpliceHack had seven defunct sin monsters, with one for each of the Seven Deadly Sins:

  • 7 Wrath
  • 7 Sloth
  • 7 Pride
  • 7 Greed
  • 7 Lust
  • 7 Gluttony
  • 7 Envy

rawPage:
{{ASCII}}
In ''[[NetHack]]'', the number '''seven''' (or '''7''') is not used to represent anything by default. However, it can still solve the following purposes:

* {{kbd|7}} and the other number keys can be used to specify a [[numeric prefix]] for a command or in a menu.

* If numpad movement is on, press {{kbd|7}} to move north-west.

* Some players also change the "monsters" option in the [[options]] file to utilize [[unused symbols]] like {{white|7}} for certain purposes, e.g. usually to represent [[golem]]s in place of the [[apostrophe]] ({{white|'}}), or [[sea monster]]s in place of the [[semicolon]] ({{white|;}}), and make them easier to see.

==Variants==
===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[lawful angels and minions]] use the {{white|7}} glyph.

dNetHack moves many of the existing lawful angelic beings and minions to the {{white|7}} glyph, and adds several more monsters that use the glyph:

* {{green|7}} [[couatl]]
* {{yellow|7}} [[Aleax]]
* {{white|7}} [[Angel]]
* {{yellow|7}} [[ki-rin]]
* {{red|7}} [[Justice Archon]]
* {{orange|7}} [[Sword Archon]]
* {{cyan|7}} [[Shield Archon]]
* {{brightgreen|7}} [[Trumpet Archon]]
* {{blue|7}} [[Warden Archon]]
* {{brightmagenta|7}} [[Throne Archon]]
* {{brightblue|7}} [[Light Archon]]
* {{gray|7}} [[Iasoian Archon]]
* {{brightmagenta|7}} [[Panakeian Archon]]
* {{brightmagenta|7}} [[Hygieian Archon]]
* {{brightmagenta|7}} [[Poro Aulon]]
* {{orange|7}} [[harrower of Zariel]]
* {{brown|7}} [[Giant Eagle]]
* {{magenta|7}} [[Barachiel]]
* {{magenta|7}} [[Domiel]]
* {{magenta|7}} [[Erathaol]]
* {{magenta|7}} [[Astaphaios]]
* {{magenta|7}} [[Raziel]]
* {{magenta|7}} [[Sealtiel]]
* {{magenta|7}} [[Zaphkiel]]
* {{gray|7}} [[God (dNetHack)|God]]
* {{brightcyan|7}} [[arcadian avenger]]
* {{cyan|7}} [[damaged arcadian avenger]]
* {{magenta|7}} [[Apollyon]]

===SpliceHack===
In older versions of [[SpliceHack]], the [[sin]] monster class was represented by the {{white|7}} glyph. Both the monster class and its members have been removed from the game in later versions, though their shared encyclopedia entry still remains in the game data.

SpliceHack had seven defunct sin monsters, with one for each of the Seven Deadly Sins:

* {{magenta|7}} Wrath
* {{magenta|7}} Sloth
* {{magenta|7}} Pride
* {{magenta|7}} Greed
* {{magenta|7}} Lust
* {{magenta|7}} Gluttony
* {{magenta|7}} Envy
{{nethack-367}}
